frc.team670.robot.dataCollection.sensors

Class NavX

  • java.lang.Object
    • frc.team670.robot.dataCollection.sensors.NavX

  • public class NavX
extends java.lang.Object
    Driver for a NavX board. Basically a wrapper for the AHRS class. Much of this was taken from 254's code release.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  NavX.NavX_Pitch_PIDSource 
      class  NavX.ZeroableNavX_Yaw_PIDSource 

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getAngle() 
      AHRS getFieldCentricNavXPIDSource()
      Gets the NavX object itself so be careful with it and don't reset it.
      NavX.NavX_Pitch_PIDSource getNavXPitchPIDSource()
      Gets the NavX's pitch as a PIDSource
      double getPitch()
      Gets the pitch of the NavX
      double getRawAccelX() 
      double getYawDouble()
      Gets the yaw with offset taken into account.
      double getYawFieldCentric()
      Gets the field centric yaw (0 degrees is forward for the robot from its starting position),
      double getYawRateDegreesPerSec()
      The rate of change of the NavX angle in degrees per second.
      double getYawRateRadiansPerSec()
      The rate of change of the NavX angle in radians per second.
      NavX.ZeroableNavX_Yaw_PIDSource getZeroableNavXYawPIDSource()
      Gets the NavX as a PIDSource that responds to the NavX being zeroed.
      void reset()
      Resets and recalibrates the NavX (yaw will go back to zero and offset cleared).
      void zeroYaw()
      Zeroes the yaw for getYawDouble()

        public NavX(SPI.Port spi_port_id)

      • NavX

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets and recalibrates the NavX (yaw will go back to zero and offset cleared). Call this right at the beginning of the match.

      • zeroYaw

        public void zeroYaw()
        Zeroes the yaw for getYawDouble()

      • getYawDouble

        public double getYawDouble()
        Gets the yaw with offset taken into account. Offset sets the zero of the gyro to the point where zeroYaw() was last called.

      • getAngle

        public double getAngle()

      • getYawRateDegreesPerSec

        public double getYawRateDegreesPerSec()
        The rate of change of the NavX angle in degrees per second.

      • getYawRateRadiansPerSec

        public double getYawRateRadiansPerSec()
        The rate of change of the NavX angle in radians per second.

      • getRawAccelX

        public double getRawAccelX()

      • getZeroableNavXYawPIDSource

        public NavX.ZeroableNavX_Yaw_PIDSource getZeroableNavXYawPIDSource()
        Gets the NavX as a PIDSource that responds to the NavX being zeroed.

      • getNavXPitchPIDSource

        public NavX.NavX_Pitch_PIDSource getNavXPitchPIDSource()
        Gets the NavX's pitch as a PIDSource

      • getFieldCentricNavXPIDSource

        public AHRS getFieldCentricNavXPIDSource()
        Gets the NavX object itself so be careful with it and don't reset it. This will be field centric.

      • getYawFieldCentric

        public double getYawFieldCentric()
        Gets the field centric yaw (0 degrees is forward for the robot from its starting position),
        Returns:
        The Yaw (-180, 180) with -180 and 180 being directly backwards.

      • getPitch

        public double getPitch()
        Gets the pitch of the NavX
